intro: Verbascum haesarense, commonly known as the Hesara mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Verbascum haesarense is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
